fr.sorbonne_u.components.endpoints

Class CompositeEndPoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.endpoints.CompositeEndPoint
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AbstractEndPointI, CompositeEndPointI, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BCMCompositeEndPoint

    public class CompositeEndPoint
extends java.lang.Object
implements CompositeEndPointI, java.lang.Cloneable
    The class CompositeEndPoint implements generic composite of several end points connecting the same client and server.

    Description

    A composite end point contains several (single) end points that can be retrieved to get their references to be used by the client to call the server. Methods inherited from AbstractEndPointI are usually applied to all of the end points in the composite.

    This implementation is not thread safe.

    Implementation Invariants

     invariant       numberOfEndPoints > 1

    Invariants

     invariant       complete() || !serverSideInitialised() && !clientSideInitialised()

    Created on : 2024-07-11

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      • CompositeEndPoint

        protected CompositeEndPoint(java.util.ArrayList<EndPointI<?>> initialEndPoints)
        create a composite end point with the given end points; to be used to implement the method copyWithSharable.

        Contract

         pre     initialEndPoints != null && initialEndPoints.size() > 0
 pre     initialEndPoints.stream().allMatch(e -> !e.serverSideInitialised())
 pre     initialEndPoints.stream().allMatch(e -> !e.clientSideInitialised())
 post    !serverSideInitialised()
 post    !clientSideInitialised()
        Parameters:
        initialEndPoints - end points to be put in the multiple end points.

      • copyWithSharable

        public CompositeEndPointI copyWithSharable()
        return a copy of this composite end point with only the sharable information.

        Description

        In a CompositeEndPoint, the following elements are considered as sharable:

        • the number of end points in the composite;
        • all of the end points with their sharable information only.

        By default, this implementation clone (i.e., shallow copy) the composite end point, clear references to the end points and replace them by fresh references to copies with sharable information of each end point (by calling copyWithSharable on each of the ones included in this composite). If a subclass introduces more non sharable elements, it will have to redefine the method to avoid copying these.

        Contract

         pre     true        // no more preconditions.
 post    true        // no more postconditions.
        Specified by:
        copyWithSharable in interface CompositeEndPointI
        Returns:
        a duplicate of this end point except its transient information.
        See Also:
        CompositeEndPointI.copyWithSharable()
